title: WFA Sunday Women Cup : Malvern Town vs Worcester City Development
body_text:
IT looks set to be a momentous occasion at Malvern Town's HDAnywhere Community Stadium on Sunday as Malvern Town Women look to book their spot in the WFA Sunday Womenâ€™s Cup Final.
They host Worcester City Development in a local derby semi-final clash, with the winners moving to within 90 minutes of silverware.
Malvern have been in sparkling form this season and sit second in the Midwest Counties Female Football League One table with just one defeat from their 13 League games and still with a chance of winning the title.
They have one final game left in the 2023/24 league campaign, which is a winner-takes-all clash with current leaders Bromsgrove Sporting. If Malvern win, they will be crowned champions, but anything less than that will see Sporting lift the trophy.
But for now, focus is very much on the cup and Malvern will be hopeful that their season will end with a trophy and the WFA Sunday Cup presents a brilliant opportunity for this incredibly successful Malvern side.
They will be up against it this weekend. Worcester Development play in the the level above Malvern in the West Midlands Regional Women's Football League Division One South.
But they have had a challenging season, only winning four of their 17 league matches.
It promises to be an exciting occasion and admission is FREE with the action kicking off at 2 pm. The Clubhouse will also be open as usual.
